blocks.content: Subset theorem for transposition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)

thm tposss(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, c1), wss(ctpos(c0), ctpos(c1)))
} = {
  3sstr4g(ctpos(c0), ctpos(c1), ccom(c0, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))), ccom(c1, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))), wss(c0, c1))
  sstrd(ccom(c0, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))), ccom(c1, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))), ccom(c1, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))), wss(c0, c1))
  coss1(c0, c1, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))))
  syl(wss(c0, c1), wss(ccom(c1, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))), ccom(c1, cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))))), wss(cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))))
  syl6eqssr(cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), cres(cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls))), wss(c0, c1))
  4syl(wss(c0, c1), wceq(cres(cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls))), cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))), wss(cdm(c0), cdm(c1)), wss(ccnv(cdm(c0)), ccnv(cdm(c1))), wss(cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls))))
  dmss(c0, c1)
  cnvss(cdm(c0), cdm(c1))
  unss1(ccnv(cdm(c0)), ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls))
  resmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0)))))
  resss(cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)))
  coss2(cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c0)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), cmpt(hs0, cun(ccnv(cdm(c1)), csn(emptycls)), cuni(ccnv(csn(cv(hs0))))), c1)

blocks.name: brtpos0
blocks.content: The behavior of ` tpos ` when the left argument is the empty set (which is not an ordered pair but is the "default" value of an ordered pair when the arguments are proper classes). This allows us to eliminate sethood hypotheses on ` A , B ` in ~ brtpos . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm brtpos0(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(emptycls, ctpos(c2), c0), wbr(emptycls, c2, c0)))
} = {
  syl6bb(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(emptycls, ctpos(c2), c0), wbr(emptycls, c2, c0), wa(wcel(emptycls, cun(ccnv(cdm(c2)), csn(emptycls))), wbr(cuni(ccnv(csn(emptycls))), c2, c0)))
  brtpos2(c0, c1, emptycls, c2)
  bitr3i(wa(wcel(emptycls, cun(ccnv(cdm(c2)), csn(emptycls))), wbr(cuni(ccnv(csn(emptycls))), c2, c0)), wbr(emptycls, c2, c0), wbr(cuni(ccnv(csn(emptycls))), c2, c0))
  biantrur(wbr(cuni(ccnv(csn(emptycls))), c2, c0), wcel(emptycls, cun(ccnv(cdm(c2)), csn(emptycls))))
  sselii(emptycls, cun(ccnv(cdm(c2)), csn(emptycls)), csn(emptycls))
  ssun2(csn(emptycls), ccnv(cdm(c2)))
  snid(emptycls)
  0ex()
  breq1i(cuni(ccnv(csn(emptycls))), c2, c0, emptycls)
  eqtri(cuni(ccnv(csn(emptycls))), emptycls, cuni(emptycls))
  unieqi(ccnv(csn(emptycls)), emptycls)
  cnvsn0()
  uni0()
}

thm brtpos0(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(∅[tpos(c2)]c0 ↔ ∅[c2]c0))
} = {
  syl6bb(c0 ∈ c1, ∅[tpos(c2)]c0, ∅[c2]c0, (∅ ∈(`' dom(c2)⋃ { ∅ })∧ ⋃ `' { ∅ }[c2]c0))
  brtpos2(c0, c1, emptycls, c2)
  bitr3i((∅ ∈(`' dom(c2)⋃ { ∅ })∧ ⋃ `' { ∅ }[c2]c0), ∅[c2]c0, ⋃ `' { ∅ }[c2]c0)
  biantrur(⋃ `' { ∅ }[c2]c0, ∅ ∈(`' dom(c2)⋃ { ∅ }))
  sselii(emptycls, (`' dom(c2)⋃ { ∅ }), { ∅ })
  ssun2({ ∅ }, `' dom(c2))
  snid(emptycls)
  0ex()
  breq1i(⋃ `' { ∅ }, c2, c0, emptycls)
  eqtri(⋃ `' { ∅ }, emptycls, ⋃ ∅)
  unieqi(`' { ∅ }, emptycls)

blocks.name: reldmtpos
blocks.content: Necessary and sufficient condition for ` dom tpos F ` to be a relation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)

thm reldmtpos(class c0) {
  |- wb(wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0))), wn(wcel(emptycls, cdm(c0))))

  impbii(wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0))), wn(wcel(emptycls, cdm(c0))))

  sylbi(wcel(emptycls, cdm(c0)), wn(wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0)))), wex(hs0, wbr(emptycls, c0, cv(hs0))))
  eldm(hs0, emptycls, c0)
  exlimiv(hs0, wbr(emptycls, c0, cv(hs0)), wn(wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0)))))
  sylbir(wbr(emptycls, c0, cv(hs0)), wn(wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0)))), wbr(emptycls, ctpos(c0), cv(hs0)))
  nsyl3(wbr(emptycls, ctpos(c0), cv(hs0)), wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0))), wcel(emptycls, cdm(ctpos(c0))))
  mtoi(wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0))), wcel(emptycls, cdm(ctpos(c0))), wcel(emptycls, cxp(universe, universe)))
  0nelxp(universe, universe)
  sylbi(wrel(cdm(ctpos(c0))), wi(wcel(emptycls, cdm(ctpos(c0))), wcel(emptycls, cxp(universe, universe))), wss(cdm(ctpos(c0)), cxp(universe, universe)))
  ssel(cdm(ctpos(c0)), cxp(universe, universe), emptycls)

  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ccnv(cdm(c0)), universe), wcel(cdm(c0), universe))

blocks.name: ovtpos
blocks.content: The transposition swaps the arguments in a two-argument function. When ` F ` is a matrix, which is to say a function from ` ( 1 ... m ) X. ( 1 ... n ) ` to ` RR ` or some ring, ` tpos F ` is the transposition of ` F ` , which is where the name comes from. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ovtpos(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(co(c0, ctpos(c1), c2), co(c2, c1, c0))

  iotabii(hs0, wbr(cop(c0, c2), ctpos(c1), cv(hs0)), wbr(cop(c2, c0), c1, cv(hs0)))
  elv(hs0, wb(wbr(cop(c0, c2), ctpos(c1), cv(hs0)), wbr(cop(c2, c0), c1, cv(hs0))))
  brtpos(cv(hs0), universe, c0, c2, c1)
  df-fv(hs0, ctpos(c1), cop(c0, c2))
  df-fv(hs0, c1, cop(c2, c0))
  df-ov(c0, ctpos(c1), c2)
  df-ov(c2, c1, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cop(c0, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(ctpos(c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cop(c2, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

thm dftpos3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {

thm dftpos3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {

  syl6ib(Rel(dom(c0)), hs0 ∈ tpos(c0), ∃(s0, ∃(s1, ∃(s2, hs0 = < < s0, s1 >, s2 >))), hs0 ∈((𝕌 × 𝕌)× 𝕌))
  sseld(hs0, tpos(c0), ((𝕌 × 𝕌)× 𝕌), Rel(dom(c0)))

  19.41vvv(s0, s1, s2, hs0 = < < s0, s1 >, s2 >, hs0 ∈ tpos(c0))
  3exbii(s0, s1, s2, (hs0 = < < s0, s1 >, s2 > ∧ hs0 ∈ tpos(c0)), (hs0 = < < s0, s1 >, s2 > ∧ < s1, s0 >[c0]s2))

  df-br(< s0, s1 >, tpos(c0), s2)

  diff.hs0.w(< s1, s0 >[{ < < s1, s0 >, s2 > | w0 }]hs2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s1)
  diff.cop.s(s2, s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs2)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s2)
  diff.hs2.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: tposmpt2
blocks.content: Transposition of a two-argument mapping. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm tposmpt2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wceq(ctpos(c0), cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c2, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpo(s1, s0, c2, c1, c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  eqtr4i(ctpos(c0), cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c2, c3), coprab(s0, s1, hs0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))))
  tposoprab(s0, s1, hs0, c0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3)))
  3eqtri(c0, coprab(s1, s0, hs0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), cmpo(s1, s0, c2, c1, c3), coprab(s1, s0, hs0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))))
  df-mpo(s1, s0, hs0, c2, c1, c3)
  oprabbii(s1, s0, hs0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3)))
  anbi1i(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c2)))
  ancom(wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  df-mpo(s0, s1, hs0, c1, c2, c3)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm tposmpt2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ tpos(c0)=(s0 ∈ c1, s1 ∈ c2 ↦ c3)
  ⊣ c0 =(s1 ∈ c2, s0 ∈ c1 ↦ c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  eqtr4i(tpos(c0), (s0 ∈ c1, s1 ∈ c2 ↦ c3), { < < s0, s1 >, hs0 > |((s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈ c2)∧ hs0 = c3)})
  tposoprab(s0, s1, hs0, c0, ((s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈ c2)∧ hs0 = c3))
  3eqtri(c0, { < < s1, s0 >, hs0 > |((s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈ c2)∧ hs0 = c3)}, (s1 ∈ c2, s0 ∈ c1 ↦ c3), { < < s1, s0 >, hs0 > |((s1 ∈ c2 ∧ s0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 = c3)})
  df-mpo(s1, s0, hs0, c2, c1, c3)
  oprabbii(s1, s0, hs0, ((s1 ∈ c2 ∧ s0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 = c3), ((s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈ c2)∧ hs0 = c3))
  anbi1i((s1 ∈ c2 ∧ s0 ∈ c1), hs0 = c3, (s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈ c2))
  ancom(s1 ∈ c2, s0 ∈ c1)
  df-mpo(s0, s1, hs0, c1, c2, c3)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}

blocks.name: tposconst
blocks.content: The transposition of a constant operation using the relation representation. (Contributed by SO, 11-Jul-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm tposconst(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(ctpos(cxp(cxp(c0, c1), csn(c2))), cxp(cxp(c1, c0), csn(c2)))
} = {
  eqtr4i(ctpos(cxp(cxp(c0, c1), csn(c2))), cxp(cxp(c1, c0), csn(c2)), cmpo(hs0, hs1, c1, c0, c2))
  tposmpt2(hs0, hs1, cxp(cxp(c0, c1), csn(c2)), c1, c0, c2)
  fconstmpt2(hs1, hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  fconstmpt2(hs0, hs1, c1, c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

thm tposconst(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ tpos(((c0 × c1)× { c2 }))=((c1 × c0)× { c2 })
} = {
  eqtr4i(tpos(((c0 × c1)× { c2 })), ((c1 × c0)× { c2 }), (hs0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈ c0 ↦ c2))
  tposmpt2(hs0, hs1, ((c0 × c1)× { c2 }), c1, c0, c2)
  fconstmpt2(hs1, hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  fconstmpt2(hs0, hs1, c1, c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}
